decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (AL(1-)00, AL(1-)01, AL(1-)02, AL(1-)03, AL(1-)04, AL(1-)11, AL(1-)20, AL(1-)21, AL(2-)02_PL Rev. F,  AL(2-)03_PL Rev. E,  AL(2-)11_PL Rev. E,  AL(2-)20_PL Rev. F Received: 30 July 2014 
AL(1-)10 Rev. A, AL(2-)00_PL Rev. F, AL(90)01_PL, AL(2-)01_PL Rev. E, AL(2-)04_PL Rev. F, AL(2-)12_PL Rev. A, Flood Risk Assessment Received: 05 August 2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 4 - The outbuilding hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as [119 Duke Road].

Condition : 5 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the side walls of the extension hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
description: Erection of a single storey side and rear extension, erection of a single storey rear garden shed, erection of a front bins and bicycle storage shed, and installation of solar panels to the front roof slope to the house
